result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey G Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for the 9/26/18 Sentencing After Revocation Hearing filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz
Judgment of Conviction mailed to defendant at Marquette County Jail and was returned marked "Inmate not here"

4:03 P.M., Defendant Lindsey G Krueger in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank with Sign Language Interpreter Sandy Peplinski, sworn.  Maura O'Connell Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Nicole Marshall appearing telephonically, Counsel has received revocation order and warrant, Court sentences defendant to:14 CF 240, Ct. 1, 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement , 2 years extended supervision, consecutive, Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program, 624 days sentence credit, 14 CF 314, Ct. 9, 4 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, consecutive, 2 years extended supervision, Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program, 56 days sentence credit, 4:45 P.M.
Filed by Attorney Ryan Frank
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 27, 2018 at 11:00 am.
for Atty Ryan Frank
